subject: Politics
title: State Media
description: A short lesson to help you apply State Media.

hook.text: Russia's RT looks like CNN. China's CGTN looks like BBC. State media now wears the disguise of independent journalism.

buildup.text: State media is funded and controlled by the government. It serves regime interests while claiming independence.

discovery.text: RT broadcasts in 30 languages. CGTN reaches 160 countries. State media is a global soft power tool.

twist.text: Not all state media is propaganda. BBC is publicly funded but editorially independent. The model matters.

climax.text: State media targets foreign audiences too. Russia Today shapes Western perceptions while CGTN courts Africa and Asia.

punchline.text: State media looks like news. The difference is who pays and who decides.

quiz.question: What makes state media different from publicly funded independent media like the BBC?
options: State media serves government interests while the BBC maintains editorial independence
There is no difference between state media and public broadcasting
The BBC is controlled by the British government
